topic.title: Do we need sex education in schools?
topic.description: An adult user now has a partner for the first time and searched the Internet for information on contraception. They found that some schools provide sex education, and wonder why this is not mandatory everywhere.
topic.narrative: On-topic images address the treatment of sex and related topics in a school setting. Pro images could be shared on social media with this text (no irony, no link): We need sex education in schools.

topic.title: Should stem cell research be expanded?
topic.description: A user recently learned that furthering new lines of stem cell research requires the destruction of a human embryo. Shocked, the user is looking for details on the ethical issues.
topic.narrative: On-topic images address the use of stem cells or embryos in labs or outcomes of corresponding research. Pro images could be shared on social media with this text (no irony, no link): We should expand stem cell research.

topic.title: Should blood donations be financially compensated?
topic.description: A user reads a report that states that hospitals need much more blood donations than are provided at the moment, and wonders why the public health system does not pay for donations.
topic.narrative: On-topic images address money and blood donations in combination or the necessity of blood donations. Pro images could be shared on social media with this text (no irony, no link): We need to financially compensate blood donations.

topic.title: Should suicide be a criminal offense?
topic.description: A user is watching the news on TV and hears about a young adult who took their own life due to immense pressure from their environment. This case somehow sticks in the user's mind. After ruminating for days, the user feels confused and unable to say how laws should deal with suicide and whether such laws would make any difference at all.
topic.narrative: On-topic images address the topic of suicide either directly or via effects of suicides. Pro images could be shared on social media with this text (no irony, no link): Suicide should be a criminal offense.

topic.title: Should agricultural subsidies be reduced?
topic.description: A user hears that the EU pays billions of euros in agricultural subsidies every year. The user thinks that this is too much and wonders what exactly is subsidized and by how much.
topic.narrative: On-topic images address agriculture in various forms, for example showing farmers or products. On-topic images are not necessarily referring to money, but could also, for example, show quality. Pro images could be shared on social media with this text (no irony, no link): We need to reduce agricultural subsidies.

topic.title: Should vigilantism be legal?
topic.description: A user was following the case of a criminal in the news and was very disappointed with what he considered to be far too lenient a sentence given to the criminal. Today, the user read that the criminal was almost killed by a civilian on his way to prison. With mixed feelings, the user examines to what extent such acts of vigilante justice could be ethically justified.
topic.narrative: On-topic images address either taking justice into one's own hands or of the state's inability to provide justice (in a particular case or in general). Pro images could be shared on social media with this text (no irony, no link): Vigilantism should be legal.

topic.title: Are gender or racial quotas effective?
topic.description: A female user recently got a job and now learns that she got the job because she was the best female applicant, even though a male applicant was rated slightly better. The user then wonders how often such quotas come into play and whether their effects are known.
topic.narrative: On-topic images address effects of either gender or racial quotas, or address implementations or statistics of such quotas. Pro images could be shared on social media with this text (no irony, no link): Gender (or racial) quotas are effective.

topic.title: Should holders of public offices resign on bad approval ratings?
topic.description: Recently, it became known that a minister wasted billions of public money, which caused his approval ratings to plummet. Yet they do not resign and their political party does not urge them to do so. One user wonders if there should be a democratic process that allows the public to force ministers to resign.
topic.narrative: On-topic images address the performance of holders of public offices, approval ratings, or resignations. Pro images could be shared on social media with this text (no irony, no link): Holders of public offices with bad approval ratings should resign.

topic.title: Should nuclear weapons be abolished?
topic.description: With the war in Ukraine, nuclear weapons have once again become a much-discussed topic, as they are described as both a threat and a security insurance policy. One user wonders which of the two is the stronger claim.
topic.narrative: On-topic images address nuclear weapons, for example their past usage, locations, or disarmament. Pro images could be shared on social media with this text (no irony, no link): We should abolish nuclear weapons.

topic.title: Should the press be subsidized?
topic.description: A user is annoyed by the advertising on the website of his favorite newspaper and wonders whether it wouldn't be better to subsidize the newspapers so that they are less dependent on advertising money.
topic.narrative: On-topic images address methods of financing press or press independence. Pro images could be shared on social media with this text (no irony, no link): We should subsidize the press.

topic.title: Is wind power the best alternative energy source?
topic.description: A user has recently heard a lot about plans in his country to invest heavily in wind energy, although solar cells have been the main topic of discussion in recent years. The user wonders if he has missed some arguments why wind energy is now preferred.
topic.narrative: On-topic images address renewable sources of energy, either comparing them or expressing absolute judgements, and include wind power. Pro images could be shared on social media with this text (no irony, no link): Wind power is the best alternative energy source.

topic.title: Is utilitarianism morally acceptable?
topic.description: A user has always been fond of the idea of utilitarianism, but has recently heard that it is a bad ideal because it discriminates against minorities. While he finds this plausible, he is also sure that utilitarianism has an answer to such accusations and would like to learn more about it.
topic.narrative: On-topic images address utilitarianism or its application in some way, for example showing numbers of positively affected people. Pro images could be shared on social media with this text (no irony, no link): Utilitarinism is morally acceptable.
